Description: Body sherd of South Ionian pottery dinos; interior reserved; exterior,white slip; decoration arranged in two friezes; upper frieze: komasts to right; uncertain object at left break; legs, arm carrying jug and kantharos probably carried in other hand of second figure; legs and body of dancing figure with cross-hatching at left shoulder; dotted cross and rosette as filling ornament; lower frieze: head of a griffin to left.
Curator's comments: Possibly joining Oxford G121.7. See Cook 1933-1934, 53. According to Cook (1933-1934, 53) the sherd does not belong to a Fikellura vase, but is possibly a poor example of Chian pottery. Neither the fabric nor the style are reminiscent of Chian decorated vases.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.419)
